questions.questionText: What is the output of: console.log(typeof null);
Which method is used to add an element to the end of an array in JavaScript?
What does the '=== ' operator do in JavaScript?
options: Checks for equality with type coercion
Checks for strict equality (value and type)
questions.correctAnswer: Checks for strict equality (value and type)

questions.questionText: What is a closure in JavaScript?
options: A function with preserved variables from its outer scope
questions.correctAnswer: A function with preserved variables from its outer scope

questions.questionText: Which built-in object in JavaScript is used to represent dates and times?
What is the purpose of the 'this' keyword in JavaScript?
options: To refer to the current function
To refer to the global object
To refer to the object it belongs to
questions.correctAnswer: To refer to the object it belongs to

questions.questionText: What is the output of: console.log(2 + '2');
Which method removes the last element from an array and returns that element?
What is the purpose of the 'JSON.parse()' method?
options: To convert a JavaScript object to a JSON string
To convert a JSON string to a JavaScript object
questions.correctAnswer: To convert a JSON string to a JavaScript object

questions.questionText: What is the output of: console.log(0.1 + 0.2 === 0.3);
What is the primary purpose of React?
What is JSX?
options: A syntax extension for JavaScript that looks like HTML
questions.correctAnswer: A syntax extension for JavaScript that looks like HTML

questions.questionText: What is a React component?
What is the purpose of 'props' in React?
options: To pass data from parent to child components
questions.correctAnswer: To pass data from parent to child components

questions.questionText: What is 'state' in React?
options: A JavaScript object that manages a component's data
questions.correctAnswer: A JavaScript object that manages a component's data

questions.questionText: Which hook is used for managing side effects in functional components?
What is the purpose of the 'key' prop when rendering lists in React?
options: To provide a unique identifier for each list item
questions.correctAnswer: To provide a unique identifier for each list item

questions.questionText: What is the name of the tool used to create a new React project?
What is the purpose of 'useState' hook?
options: To manage state in functional components
questions.correctAnswer: To manage state in functional components

questions.questionText: How do you conditionally render elements in React?
options: Using if statements or ternary operators
questions.correctAnswer: Using if statements or ternary operators
